Clarify the transmission chain with numeric yields: Fed cut → 2‑yr yield ↓ ≈ 10 bp → 10‑yr yield ↑ ≈ 20 bp → steepening → real yield differential ↑ ≈ 10 bp → DXY ↑. Add risk mapping: a Fed rate hike → 10‑yr yield ↑, flattening → DXY ↓ (cite LF0UUL917); a 1‑2 % rise in the 30‑yr Treasury → mortgage rates ↑ 20–30 bp → credit tightening → DXY pressure (cite LF0UUL917). Include a watch‑list sentence: “Monitor September Fed meeting minutes, early‑August CPI, Aug 30 PCE, Aug 31 NFP, 2‑yr/10‑yr spread, and 30‑yr Treasury yield for confirmation or reversal.” Remove any mention of the Jackson Hole symposium unless it directly feeds the Fed cut signal.
